listitem.para: This command copies part of the image and stores it in memory (or the clipboard, if BITINDEX is 0). Anytime later, you can use BITPASTE to "paste" it into the image. &PRODUCTNAME; will copy starting at the turtle's position with a width of the first input and a height of the second input. See also SETBITINDEX.
The width and height inputs are measured in pixels and specify the amount of the image that is copied. The bitmap is always taken horizontally and vertically, regardless of the turtle's heading.

programlisting.userinput: SETPENSIZE [2 2] REPEAT 72 [REPEAT 4 [FORWARD 100 RIGHT 90] SETPENCOLOR (LIST REPCOUNT*3 0 0) RIGHT 5] PENUP SETXY -50 -50 BITCOPY 100 100 CLEARSCREEN PENUP REPEAT 36 [FORWARD 150 BITPASTE BACK 150 RIGHT 10]
